title_sort: manvill wintersteen to walt whitman, 1 march 1875
title: Manvill Wintersteen to Walt Whitman, 1 March 1875
text: Hampden, Ohio,March 1, 1875Kind sir,I received your card was glad to here[hear] from a soldiers[soldier's] friend in time of need and if you are the friend that took care of me I am glad to here[hear] from you I can not place you as I did not learn your name but havent[haven't] forgot the kindness I recived[received] while in the Army[Armory] Square Hospital I would like to see youI draw a small pencion[pension] am owing to york State grafting in a bout[about] 3 weeksI guess you are the friend that wrote a letter for me when I first came to the hospitalI am glad to here[hear] from eny one[anyone] write againmy respects and good wishes Manvill Wintersteen to Walt Whitman, 1 March 1875
